problem: How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour?
solution: The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
chatgpt_solution: Since we know that the car travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as the train, we find that the car's speed is $ \,  \frac{3}{4} \times 80 \, $ miles per hour, or $ \, 3 \times 20 \, $ miles per hour.  In $ \, 20 \, $ minutes the car would travel $ \, \frac{3 \cdot 20}{60} \, $ miles.  Multiplying fractions gives $$\frac{3 \cdot 20}{60} = \frac{3 \cdot (2 \cdot 10)}{3 \cdot 20} = \frac{2 \cdot 10}{20} = \boxed{10} \, \text{miles}.$$
